Inline forms

Use the .form-inline class to display a series of labels, form controls, and buttons on a single horizontal row. Form controls within inline forms vary slightly from their default states.

Controls are display: flex, collapsing any HTML white space and allowing you to provide alignment control with spacing and flexbox utilities.
Controls and input groups receive width: auto to override the framekit default width: 100%.
Controls only appear inline in viewports that are at least 576px wide to account for narrow viewports on mobile devices.

You may need to manually address the width and alignment of individual form controls with spacing utilities (as shown below). Lastly, be sure to always include a label with each form control, even if you need to hide it from non-screenreader visitors with .sr-only.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputName2"Name/label
  input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2" id="inlineFormInputName2" placeholder="Jane Doe"

  label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputGroupUsername2"Username/label
  div class="fk-input-group fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2"
    div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
      div class="fk-input-group-text"@/div
    /div
    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inlineFormInputGroupUsername2" placeholder="Username"
  /div

  div class="fk-form-check fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2"
    input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="inlineFormCheck"
    label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineFormCheck"
      Remember me
    /label
  /div

  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-mb-2"Submit/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom form controls and selects are also supported.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  label class="fk-my-1 fk-mr-2" for="inlineFormCustomSelectPref"Preference/label
  select class="fk-custom-select fk-my-1 fk-mr-sm-2" id="inlineFormCustomSelectPref"
    option selectedChoose.../option
    option value="1"One/option
    option value="2"Two/option
    option value="3"Three/option
  /select

  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox fk-my-1 fk-mr-sm-2"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlInline"
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlInline"Remember my preference/label
  /div

  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-my-1"Submit/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Alternatives to hidden labels
Assistive technologies such as screen readers will have trouble with your forms if you don't include a label for every input. For these inline forms, you can hide the labels using the .sr-only class. There are further alternative methods of providing a label for assistive technologies, such as the aria-label, aria-labelledby or title attribute. If none of these are present, assistive technologies may resort to using the placeholder attribute, if present, but note that use of placeholder as a replacement for other labelling methods is not advised.
/div

Help text

Block-level help text in forms can be created using .form-text (previously known as .help-block in v3). Inline help text can be flexibly implemented using any inline HTML element and utility classes like .text-muted.

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Associating help text with form controls

Help text should be explicitly associated with the form control it relates to using the aria-describedby attribute. This will ensure that assistive technologies—such as screen readers—will announce this help text when the user focuses or enters the control.
/div

Help text below inputs can be styled with .form-text. This class includes display: block and adds some top margin for easy spacing from the inputs above.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="inputPassword5"Password/label
input type="password" id="inputPassword5" class="fk-form-control" aria-describedby="passwordHelpBlock"
small id="passwordHelpBlock" class="fk-form-text fk-text-muted"
  Your password must be 8-20 characters long, contain letters and numbers, and must not contain spaces, special characters, or emoji.
/small
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Inline text can use any typical inline HTML element (be it a small, span, or something else) with nothing more than a utility class.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="inputPassword6"Password/label
    input type="password" id="inputPassword6" class="fk-form-control fk-mx-sm-3" aria-describedby="passwordHelpInline"
    small id="passwordHelpInline" class="fk-text-muted"
      Must be 8-20 characters long.
    /small
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Disabled forms

Add the disabled boolean attribute on an input to prevent user interactions and make it appear lighter.

{{ highlight html }}
input class="fk-form-control" id="disabledInput" type="text" placeholder="Disabled input here..." disabled
{{ /highlight }}

Add the disabled attribute to a fieldset to disable all the controls within.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  fieldset disabled
    div class="fk-form-group"
      label for="disabledTextInput"Disabled input/label
      input type="text" id="disabledTextInput" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="Disabled input"
    /div
    div class="fk-form-group"
      label for="disabledSelect"Disabled select menu/label
      select id="disabledSelect" class="fk-form-control"
        optionDisabled select/option
      /select
    /div
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="disabledFieldsetCheck" disabled
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="disabledFieldsetCheck"
        Can't check this
      /label
    /div
    button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary"Submit/button
  /fieldset
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Caveat with anchors

By default, browsers will treat all native form controls (input, select and button elements) inside a fieldset disabled as disabled, preventing both keyboard and mouse interactions on them. However, if your form also includes a ... class="fk-btn fk-btn-*" elements, these will only be given a style of pointer-events: none. As noted in the section about disabled state for buttons (and specifically in the sub-section for anchor elements), this CSS property is not yet standardized and isn't fully supported in Internet Explorer 10, and won't prevent keyboard users from being able to focus or activate these links. So to be safe, use custom JavaScript to disable such links.
/div

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
Cross-browser compatibility

While framekit will apply these styles in all browsers, Internet Explorer 11 and below don't fully support the disabled attribute on a fieldset. Use custom JavaScript to disable the fieldset in these browsers.
/div
{{include "callout" content=callout type="danger"}}

 Validation

Provide valuable, actionable feedback to your users with HTML5 form validation–available in all our supported browsers. Choose from the browser default validation feedback, or implement custom messages with our built-in classes and starter JavaScript.

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
We currently recommend using custom validation styles, as native browser default validation messages are not consistently exposed to assistive technologies in all browsers (most notably, Chrome on desktop and mobile).
/div

How it works

Here's how form validation works with framekit:

HTML form validation is applied via CSS's two pseudo-classes, :invalid and :valid. It applies to input, select, and textarea elements.
framekit scopes the :invalid and :valid styles to parent .was-validated class, usually applied to the form. Otherwise, any required field without a value shows up as invalid on page load. This way, you may choose when to activate them (typically after form submission is attempted).
To reset the appearance of the form (for instance, in the case of dynamic form submissions using AJAX), remove the .was-validated class from the form again after submission.
As a fallback, .is-invalid and .is-valid classes may be used instead of the pseudo-classes for server side validation. They do not require a .was-validated parent class.
Due to constraints in how CSS works, we cannot (at present) apply styles to a label that comes before a form control in the DOM without the help of custom JavaScript.
All modern browsers support the constraint validation API, a series of JavaScript methods for validating form controls.
Feedback messages may utilize the browser defaults (different for each browser, and unstylable via CSS) or our custom feedback styles with additional HTML and CSS.
You may provide custom validity messages with setCustomValidity in JavaScript.

With that in mind, consider the following demos for our custom form validation styles, optional server side classes, and browser defaults.

 Custom styles

For custom framekit form validation messages, you'll need to add the novalidate boolean attribute to your form. This disables the browser default feedback tooltips, but still provides access to the form validation APIs in JavaScript. Try to submit the form below; our JavaScript will intercept the submit button and relay feedback to you.

When attempting to submit, you'll see the :invalid and :valid styles applied to your form controls.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-needs-validation" novalidate
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom01"First name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom01" placeholder="First name" value="Mark" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustomUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="inputGroupPrepend"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustomUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="inputGroupPrepend" required
        div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
          Please choose a username.
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom03" placeholder="City" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid city.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom04" placeholder="State" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid state.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom05" placeholder="Zip" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid zip.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="invalidCheck" required
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="invalidCheck"
        Agree to terms and conditions
      /label
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        You must agree before submitting.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form

script
// Example starter JavaScript for disabling form submissions if there are invalid fields
(function() {
  'use strict';
  window.addEventListener('load', function() {
    // Fetch all the forms we want to apply custom framekit validation styles to
    var forms = document.getElementsByClassName('needs-validation');
    // Loop over them and prevent submission
    var validation = Array.prototype.filter.call(forms, function(form) {
      form.addEventListener('submit', function(event) {
        if (form.checkValidity() === false) {
          event.preventDefault();
          event.stopPropagation();
        }
        form.classList.add('was-validated');
      }, false);
    });
  }, false);
})();
/script
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"

    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"

    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"

    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"

 Server side

We recommend using client side validation, but in case you require server side, you can indicate invalid and valid form fields with .is-invalid and .is-valid. Note that .invalid-feedback is also supported with these classes.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer01"First name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-valid" id="validationServer01" placeholder="First name" value="Mark" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-valid" id="validationServer02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServerUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="inputGroupPrepend3"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-invalid" id="validationServerUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="inputGroupPrepend3" required
        div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
          Please choose a username.
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-invalid" id="validationServer03" placeholder="City" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid city.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-invalid" id="validationServer04" placeholder="State" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid state.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-is-invalid" id="validationServer05" placeholder="Zip" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid zip.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input fk-is-invalid" type="checkbox" value="" id="invalidCheck3" required
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="invalidCheck3"
        Agree to terms and conditions
      /label
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        You must agree before submitting.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Supported elements

Our example forms show native textual inputs above, but form validation styles are available for our custom form controls, too.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-was-validated"
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox fk-mb-3"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation1" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation1"Check this custom checkbox/label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"Example invalid feedback text/div
  /div

  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
    input type="radio" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation2" name="radio-stacked" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation2"Toggle this custom radio/label
  /div
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-mb-3"
    input type="radio" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation3" name="radio-stacked" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation3"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"More example invalid feedback text/div
  /div

  div class="fk-form-group"
    select class="fk-custom-select" required
      option value=""Open this select menu/option
      option value="1"One/option
      option value="2"Two/option
      option value="3"Three/option
    /select
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"Example invalid custom select feedback/div
  /div

  div class="fk-custom-file"
    input type="file" class="fk-custom-file-input" id="validatedCustomFile" required
    label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="validatedCustomFile"Choose file.../label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"Example invalid custom file feedback/div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Tooltips

If your form layout allows it, you can swap the .{valid|invalid}-feedback classes for .{valid|invalid}-tooltip classes to display validation feedback in a styled tooltip. Be sure to have a parent with position: relative on it for tooltip positioning. In the example below, our column classes have this already, but your project may require an alternative setup.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-needs-validation" novalidate
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip01"First name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip01" placeholder="First name" value="Mark" required
      div class="fk-valid-tooltip"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
      div class="fk-valid-tooltip"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltipUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="validationTooltipUsernamePrepend"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltipUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="validationTooltipUsernamePrepend" required
        div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
          Please choose a unique and valid username.
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip03" placeholder="City" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid city.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip04" placeholder="State" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid state.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip05" placeholder="Zip" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid zip.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom forms

For even more customization and cross browser consistency, use our completely custom form elements to replace the browser defaults. They're built on top of semantic and accessible markup, so they're solid replacements for any default form control.

 Checkboxes and radios

Each checkbox and radio is wrapped in a div with a sibling span to create our custom control and a label for the accompanying text. Structurally, this is the same approach as our default .form-check.

We use the sibling selector (~) for all our input states—like :checked—to properly style our custom form indicator. When combined with the .custom-control-label class, we can also style the text for each item based on the input's state.

We hide the default input with opacity and use the .custom-control-label to build a new custom form indicator in its place with ::before and ::after. Unfortunately we can't build a custom one from just the input because CSS's content doesn't work on that element.

In the checked states, we use base64 embedded SVG icons from Open Iconic. This provides us the best control for styling and positioning across browsers and devices.

Checkboxes

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
  input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheck1"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheck1"Check this custom checkbox/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom checkboxes can also utilize the :indeterminate pseudo class when manually set via JavaScript (there is no available HTML attribute for specifying it).

div class="bd-example bd-example-indeterminate"
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheck2"
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheck2"Check this custom checkbox/label
  /div
/div

If you're using jQuery, something like this should suffice:

{{ highlight html }}
$('.your-checkbox').prop('indeterminate', true)
{{ /highlight }}

 Radios

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="customRadio1" name="customRadio" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadio1"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="customRadio2" name="customRadio" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadio2"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Inline

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-custom-control-inline"
  input type="radio" id="customRadioInline1" name="customRadioInline1" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioInline1"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-custom-control-inline"
  input type="radio" id="customRadioInline2" name="customRadioInline1" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioInline2"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Disabled

Custom checkboxes and radios can also be disabled. Add the disabled boolean attribute to the input and the custom indicator and label description will be automatically styled.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
  input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheckDisabled" disabled
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheckDisabled"Check this custom checkbox/label
/div

div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="radio3" name="radioDisabled" id="customRadioDisabled" class="fk-custom-control-input" disabled
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioDisabled"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Select menu

Custom select menus need only a custom class, .custom-select to trigger the custom styles.

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

You may also choose from small and large custom selects to match our similarly sized text inputs.

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select fk-custom-select-lg fk-mb-3"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select

select class="fk-custom-select fk-custom-select-sm"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

The multiple attribute is also supported:

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select" multiple
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

As is the size attribute:

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select" size="3"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Range

Create custom input type="range" controls with .custom-range. The track (the background) and thumb (the value) are both styled to appear the same across browsers. As only IE and Firefox support "filling" their track from the left or right of the thumb as a means to visually indicate progress, we do not currently support it.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange1"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" id="customRange1"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Range inputs have implicit values for min and max—0 and 100, respectively. You may specify new values for those using the min and max attributes.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange2"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" min="0" max="5" id="customRange2"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

By default, range inputs "snap" to integer values. To change this, you can specify a step value. In the example below, we double the number of steps by using step="0.5".

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange3"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" min="0" max="5" step="0.5" id="customRange3"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

File browser

The file input is the most gnarly of the bunch and requires additional JavaScript if you'd like to hook them up with functional Choose file... and selected file name text.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-file"
  input type="file" class="fk-custom-file-input" id="customFile"
  label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="customFile"Choose file/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

We hide the default file input via opacity and instead style the label. The button is generated and positioned with ::after. Lastly, we declare a width and height on the input for proper spacing for surrounding content.

 Translating or customizing the strings

The :lang() pseudo-class is used to allow for translation of the "Browse" text into other languages. Override or add entries to the $custom-file-text Sass variable with the relevant language tag and localized strings. The English strings can be customized the same way. For example, here's how one might add a Spanish translation (Spanish's language code is es):

{{ highlight html }}

$custom-file-text: (
  en: "Browse",
  es: "Elegir"
);

{{ /highlight }}

Here's lang(es) in action on the custom file input for a Spanish translation:

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-file"
  input type="file" class="fk-custom-file-input" id="customFileLang" lang="es"
  label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="customFileLang"Seleccionar Archivo/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

You'll need to set the language of your document (or subtree thereof) correctly in order for the correct text to be shown. This can be done using the lang attribute on the html element or the Content-Language HTTP header, among other methods.
",
        "tags": []
    },
    {
        "uri": "/src/content/components/forms/forms4",
        "content": "---
layout: docs
title: Forms
description: Examples and usage guidelines for form control styles, layout options, and custom components for creating a wide variety of forms.
group: components
toc: true
---

THIS IS FROM TWITTER BOOTSTRAP

Overview

framekit's form controls expand on our Rebooted form styles with classes. Use these classes to opt into their customized displays for a more consistent rendering across browsers and devices.

Be sure to use an appropriate type attribute on all inputs (e.g., email for email address or number for numerical information) to take advantage of newer input controls like email verification, number selection, and more.

Here's a quick example to demonstrate framekit's form styles. Keep reading for documentation on required classes, form layout, and more.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleInputEmail1"Email address/label
    input type="email" class="fk-form-control" id="exampleInputEmail1" aria-describedby="emailHelp" placeholder="Enter email"
    small id="emailHelp" class="fk-form-text fk-text-muted"We'll never share your email with anyone else./small
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleInputPassword1"Password/label
    input type="password" class="fk-form-control" id="exampleInputPassword1" placeholder="Password"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-form-check"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-form-check-input" id="exampleCheck1"
    label class="fk-form-check-label" for="exampleCheck1"Check me out/label
  /div
  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary"Submit/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Form controls

Textual form controls—like inputs, selects, and textareas—are styled with the .form-control class. Included are styles for general appearance, focus state, sizing, and more.

Be sure to explore our custom forms to further style selects.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleFormControlInput1"Email address/label
    input type="email" class="fk-form-control" id="exampleFormControlInput1" placeholder="name@example.com"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleFormControlSelect1"Example select/label
    select class="fk-form-control" id="exampleFormControlSelect1"
      option1/option
      option2/option
      option3/option
      option4/option
      option5/option
    /select
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleFormControlSelect2"Example multiple select/label
    select multiple class="fk-form-control" id="exampleFormControlSelect2"
      option1/option
      option2/option
      option3/option
      option4/option
      option5/option
    /select
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleFormControlTextarea1"Example textarea/label
    textarea class="fk-form-control" id="exampleFormControlTextarea1" rows="3"/textarea
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

For file inputs, swap the .form-control for .form-control-file.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="exampleFormControlFile1"Example file input/label
    input type="file" class="fk-form-control-file" id="exampleFormControlFile1"
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Sizing

Set heights using classes like .form-control-lg and .form-control-sm.

{{capture 'example'}}
input class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-lg" type="text" placeholder=".form-control-lg"
input class="fk-form-control" type="text" placeholder="Default input"
input class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-sm" type="text" placeholder=".form-control-sm"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-lg"
  optionLarge select/option
/select
select class="fk-form-control"
  optionDefault select/option
/select
select class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-sm"
  optionSmall select/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Range Inputs

Set horizontally scrollable range inputs using .form-control-range.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="formControlRange"Example Range input/label
    input type="range" class="fk-form-control-range" id="formControlRange"
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Readonly

Add the readonly boolean attribute on an input to prevent modification of the input's value. Read-only inputs appear lighter (just like disabled inputs), but retain the standard cursor.

{{capture 'example'}}
input class="fk-form-control" type="text" placeholder="Readonly input here…" readonly
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Readonly plain text

If you want to have input readonly elements in your form styled as plain text, use the .form-control-plaintext class to remove the default form field styling and preserve the correct margin and padding.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="staticEmail" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label"Email/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="text" readonly class="fk-form-control-plaintext" id="staticEmail" value="email@example.com"
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="inputPassword" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label"Password/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="password" class="fk-form-control" id="inputPassword" placeholder="Password"
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  div class="fk-form-group fk-mb-2"
    label for="staticEmail2" class="sr-only"Email/label
    input type="text" readonly class="fk-form-control-plaintext" id="staticEmail2" value="email@example.com"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-mx-sm-3 fk-mb-2"
    label for="inputPassword2" class="sr-only"Password/label
    input type="password" class="fk-form-control" id="inputPassword2" placeholder="Password"
  /div
  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-mb-2"Confirm identity/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Checkboxes and radios

Default checkboxes and radios are improved upon with the help of .form-check, a single class for both input types that improves the layout and behavior of their HTML elements. Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.

Disabled checkboxes and radios are supported, but to provide a not-allowed cursor on hover of the parent label, you'll need to add the disabled attribute to the .form-check-input. The disabled attribute will apply a lighter color to help indicate the input's state.

Checkboxes and radios use are built to support HTML-based form validation and provide concise, accessible labels. As such, our inputs and labels are sibling elements as opposed to an input within a label. This is slightly more verbose as you must specify id and for attributes to relate the input and label.

 Default (stacked)

By default, any number of checkboxes and radios that are immediate sibling will be vertically stacked and appropriately spaced with .form-check.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="defaultCheck1"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="defaultCheck1"
    Default checkbox
  /label
/div
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="defaultCheck2" disabled
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="defaultCheck2"
    Disabled checkbox
  /label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="exampleRadios" id="exampleRadios1" value="option1" checked
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="exampleRadios1"
    Default radio
  /label
/div
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="exampleRadios" id="exampleRadios2" value="option2"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="exampleRadios2"
    Second default radio
  /label
/div
div class="fk-form-check fk-disabled"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="exampleRadios" id="exampleRadios3" value="option3" disabled
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="exampleRadios3"
    Disabled radio
  /label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Inline

Group checkboxes or radios on the same horizontal row by adding .form-check-inline to any .form-check.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="inlineCheckbox1" value="option1"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineCheckbox1"1/label
/div
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="inlineCheckbox2" value="option2"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineCheckbox2"2/label
/div
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="inlineCheckbox3" value="option3" disabled
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineCheckbox3"3 (disabled)/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="inlineRadioOptions" id="inlineRadio1" value="option1"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineRadio1"1/label
/div
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="inlineRadioOptions" id="inlineRadio2" value="option2"
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineRadio2"2/label
/div
div class="fk-form-check fk-form-check-inline"
  input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="inlineRadioOptions" id="inlineRadio3" value="option3" disabled
  label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineRadio3"3 (disabled)/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Without labels

Add .position-static to inputs within .form-check that don't have any label text. Remember to still provide some form of label for assistive technologies (for instance, using aria-label).

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input fk-position-static" type="checkbox" id="blankCheckbox" value="option1" aria-label="..."
/div
div class="fk-form-check"
  input class="fk-form-check-input fk-position-static" type="radio" name="blankRadio" id="blankRadio1" value="option1" aria-label="..."
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Layout

Since framekit applies display: block and width: 100% to almost all our form controls, forms will by default stack vertically. Additional classes can be used to vary this layout on a per-form basis.

 Form groups

The .form-group class is the easiest way to add some structure to forms. It provides a flexible class that encourages proper grouping of labels, controls, optional help text, and form validation messaging. By default it only applies margin-bottom, but it picks up additional styles in .form-inline as needed. Use it with fieldsets, divs, or nearly any other element.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="formGroupExampleInput"Example label/label
    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="formGroupExampleInput" placeholder="Example input"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="formGroupExampleInput2"Another label/label
    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="formGroupExampleInput2" placeholder="Another input"
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Form grid

More complex forms can be built using our grid classes. Use these for form layouts that require multiple columns, varied widths, and additional alignment options.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-row"
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="First name"
    /div
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="Last name"
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Form row

You may also swap .row for .form-row, a variation of our standard grid row that overrides the default column gutters for tighter and more compact layouts.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="First name"
    /div
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="Last name"
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

More complex layouts can also be created with the grid system.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-form-group fk-col-md-6"
      label for="inputEmail4"Email/label
      input type="email" class="fk-form-control" id="inputEmail4" placeholder="Email"
    /div
    div class="fk-form-group fk-col-md-6"

    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inputAddress" placeholder="1234 Main St"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="inputAddress2"Address 2/label
    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inputAddress2" placeholder="Apartment, studio, or floor"
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-form-group fk-col-md-6"
      label for="inputCity"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inputCity"
    /div
    div class="fk-form-group fk-col-md-4"
      label for="inputState"State/label
      select id="inputState" class="fk-form-control"
        option selectedChoose.../option
        option.../option
      /select
    /div
    div class="fk-form-group fk-col-md-2"
      label for="inputZip"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inputZip"
    /div

  div class="fk-form-group"

      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="gridCheck"

  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary"Sign in/button

Horizontal form

Create horizontal forms with the grid by adding the .row class to form groups and using the .col-*-* classes to specify the width of your labels and controls. Be sure to add .col-form-label to your labels as well so they're vertically centered with their associated form controls.

At times, you maybe need to use margin or padding utilities to create that perfect alignment you need. For example, we've removed the padding-top on our stacked radio inputs label to better align the text baseline.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="inputEmail3" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label"Email/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="email" class="fk-form-control" id="inputEmail3" placeholder="Email"
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="inputPassword3" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label"Password/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="password" class="fk-form-control" id="inputPassword3" placeholder="Password"
    /div
  /div
  fieldset class="fk-form-group"
    div class="fk-row"
      legend class="fk-col-form-label fk-col-sm-2 fk-pt-0"Radios/legend
      div class="fk-col-sm-10"
        div class="fk-form-check"
          input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="gridRadios" id="gridRadios1" value="option1" checked
          label class="fk-form-check-label" for="gridRadios1"
            First radio
          /label
        /div
        div class="fk-form-check"
          input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="gridRadios" id="gridRadios2" value="option2"
          label class="fk-form-check-label" for="gridRadios2"
            Second radio
          /label
        /div
        div class="fk-form-check fk-disabled"
          input class="fk-form-check-input" type="radio" name="gridRadios" id="gridRadios3" value="option3" disabled
          label class="fk-form-check-label" for="gridRadios3"
            Third disabled radio
          /label
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /fieldset
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    div class="fk-col-sm-2"Checkbox/div
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      div class="fk-form-check"
        input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="gridCheck1"
        label class="fk-form-check-label" for="gridCheck1"
          Example checkbox
        /label
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary"Sign in/button
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Horizontal form label sizing

Be sure to use .col-form-label-sm or .col-form-label-lg to your labels or legends to correctly follow the size of .form-control-lg and .form-control-sm.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="colFormLabelSm" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label fk-col-form-label-sm"Email/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="email" class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-sm" id="colFormLabelSm" placeholder="col-form-label-sm"
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="colFormLabel" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label"Email/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="email" class="fk-form-control" id="colFormLabel" placeholder="col-form-label"
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group fk-row"
    label for="colFormLabelLg" class="fk-col-sm-2 fk-col-form-label fk-col-form-label-lg"Email/label
    div class="fk-col-sm-10"
      input type="email" class="fk-form-control fk-form-control-lg" id="colFormLabelLg" placeholder="col-form-label-lg"
    /div

Column sizing

As shown in the previous examples, our grid system allows you to place any number of .cols within a .row or .form-row. They'll split the available width equally between them. You may also pick a subset of your columns to take up more or less space, while the remaining .cols equally split the rest, with specific column classes like .col-7.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-7"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="City"
    /div
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="State"
    /div
    div class="fk-col"
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="Zip"
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Auto-sizing

The example below uses a flexbox utility to vertically center the contents and changes .col to .col-auto so that your columns only take up as much space as needed. Put another way, the column sizes itself based on the contents.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row fk-align-items-center"
    div class="fk-col-auto"
      label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInput"Name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-mb-2" id="inlineFormInput" placeholder="Jane Doe"
    /div
    div class="fk-col-auto"
      label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputGroup"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group fk-mb-2"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          div class="fk-input-group-text"@/div
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inlineFormInputGroup" placeholder="Username"
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-auto"
      div class="fk-form-check fk-mb-2"
        input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="autoSizingCheck"
        label class="fk-form-check-label" for="autoSizingCheck"
          Remember me
        /label
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-auto"
      button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-mb-2"Submit/button
    /div
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

      label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputName"Name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inlineFormInputName" placeholder="Jane Doe"

And of course custom form controls are supported.

Inline forms

Use the .form-inline class to display a series of labels, form controls, and buttons on a single horizontal row. Form controls within inline forms vary slightly from their default states.

Controls are display: flex, collapsing any HTML white space and allowing you to provide alignment control with spacing and flexbox utilities.
Controls and input groups receive width: auto to override the framekit default width: 100%.
Controls only appear inline in viewports that are at least 576px wide to account for narrow viewports on mobile devices.

You may need to manually address the width and alignment of individual form controls with spacing utilities (as shown below). Lastly, be sure to always include a label with each form control, even if you need to hide it from non-screenreader visitors with .sr-only.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputName2"Name/label
  input type="text" class="fk-form-control fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2" id="inlineFormInputName2" placeholder="Jane Doe"

  label class="sr-only" for="inlineFormInputGroupUsername2"Username/label
  div class="fk-input-group fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2"
    div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
      div class="fk-input-group-text"@/div
    /div
    input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="inlineFormInputGroupUsername2" placeholder="Username"
  /div

  div class="fk-form-check fk-mb-2 fk-mr-sm-2"
    input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="inlineFormCheck"
    label class="fk-form-check-label" for="inlineFormCheck"
      Remember me
    /label
  /div

  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-mb-2"Submit/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom form controls and selects are also supported.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  label class="fk-my-1 fk-mr-2" for="inlineFormCustomSelectPref"Preference/label
  select class="fk-custom-select fk-my-1 fk-mr-sm-2" id="inlineFormCustomSelectPref"
    option selectedChoose.../option
    option value="1"One/option
    option value="2"Two/option
    option value="3"Three/option
  /select

  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox fk-my-1 fk-mr-sm-2"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlInline"
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlInline"Remember my preference/label
  /div

  button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary fk-my-1"Submit/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Alternatives to hidden labels
Assistive technologies such as screen readers will have trouble with your forms if you don't include a label for every input. For these inline forms, you can hide the labels using the .sr-only class. There are further alternative methods of providing a label for assistive technologies, such as the aria-label, aria-labelledby or title attribute. If none of these are present, assistive technologies may resort to using the placeholder attribute, if present, but note that use of placeholder as a replacement for other labelling methods is not advised.
/div

Help text

Block-level help text in forms can be created using .form-text (previously known as .help-block in v3). Inline help text can be flexibly implemented using any inline HTML element and utility classes like .text-muted.

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Associating help text with form controls

Help text should be explicitly associated with the form control it relates to using the aria-describedby attribute. This will ensure that assistive technologies—such as screen readers—will announce this help text when the user focuses or enters the control.
/div

Help text below inputs can be styled with .form-text. This class includes display: block and adds some top margin for easy spacing from the inputs above.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="inputPassword5"Password/label
input type="password" id="inputPassword5" class="fk-form-control" aria-describedby="passwordHelpBlock"
small id="passwordHelpBlock" class="fk-form-text fk-text-muted"
  Your password must be 8-20 characters long, contain letters and numbers, and must not contain spaces, special characters, or emoji.
/small
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Inline text can use any typical inline HTML element (be it a small, span, or something else) with nothing more than a utility class.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-form-inline"
  div class="fk-form-group"
    label for="inputPassword6"Password/label
    input type="password" id="inputPassword6" class="fk-form-control fk-mx-sm-3" aria-describedby="passwordHelpInline"
    small id="passwordHelpInline" class="fk-text-muted"
      Must be 8-20 characters long.
    /small
  /div
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Disabled forms

Add the disabled boolean attribute on an input to prevent user interactions and make it appear lighter.

{{ highlight html }}
input class="fk-form-control" id="disabledInput" type="text" placeholder="Disabled input here..." disabled
{{ /highlight }}

Add the disabled attribute to a fieldset to disable all the controls within.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  fieldset disabled
    div class="fk-form-group"
      label for="disabledTextInput"Disabled input/label
      input type="text" id="disabledTextInput" class="fk-form-control" placeholder="Disabled input"
    /div
    div class="fk-form-group"
      label for="disabledSelect"Disabled select menu/label
      select id="disabledSelect" class="fk-form-control"
        optionDisabled select/option
      /select
    /div
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" id="disabledFieldsetCheck" disabled
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="disabledFieldsetCheck"
        Can't check this
      /label
    /div
    button type="submit" class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary"Submit/button
  /fieldset
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
 Caveat with anchors

By default, browsers will treat all native form controls (input, select and button elements) inside a fieldset disabled as disabled, preventing both keyboard and mouse interactions on them. However, if your form also includes a ... class="fk-btn fk-btn-*" elements, these will only be given a style of pointer-events: none. As noted in the section about disabled state for buttons (and specifically in the sub-section for anchor elements), this CSS property is not yet standardized and isn't fully supported in Internet Explorer 10, and won't prevent keyboard users from being able to focus or activate these links. So to be safe, use custom JavaScript to disable such links.
/div

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
Cross-browser compatibility

While framekit will apply these styles in all browsers, Internet Explorer 11 and below don't fully support the disabled attribute on a fieldset. Use custom JavaScript to disable the fieldset in these browsers.
/div
{{include "callout" content=callout type="danger"}}

 Validation

Provide valuable, actionable feedback to your users with HTML5 form validation–available in all our supported browsers. Choose from the browser default validation feedback, or implement custom messages with our built-in classes and starter JavaScript.

div class="bd-callout bd-callout-warning"
We currently recommend using custom validation styles, as native browser default validation messages are not consistently exposed to assistive technologies in all browsers (most notably, Chrome on desktop and mobile).
/div

How it works

Here's how form validation works with framekit:

HTML form validation is applied via CSS's two pseudo-classes, :invalid and :valid. It applies to input, select, and textarea elements.
framekit scopes the :invalid and :valid styles to parent .was-validated class, usually applied to the form. Otherwise, any required field without a value shows up as invalid on page load. This way, you may choose when to activate them (typically after form submission is attempted).
To reset the appearance of the form (for instance, in the case of dynamic form submissions using AJAX), remove the .was-validated class from the form again after submission.
As a fallback, .is-invalid and .is-valid classes may be used instead of the pseudo-classes for server side validation. They do not require a .was-validated parent class.
Due to constraints in how CSS works, we cannot (at present) apply styles to a label that comes before a form control in the DOM without the help of custom JavaScript.
All modern browsers support the constraint validation API, a series of JavaScript methods for validating form controls.
Feedback messages may utilize the browser defaults (different for each browser, and unstylable via CSS) or our custom feedback styles with additional HTML and CSS.
You may provide custom validity messages with setCustomValidity in JavaScript.

With that in mind, consider the following demos for our custom form validation styles, optional server side classes, and browser defaults.

 Custom styles

For custom framekit form validation messages, you'll need to add the novalidate boolean attribute to your form. This disables the browser default feedback tooltips, but still provides access to the form validation APIs in JavaScript. Try to submit the form below; our JavaScript will intercept the submit button and relay feedback to you.

When attempting to submit, you'll see the :invalid and :valid styles applied to your form controls.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-needs-validation" novalidate
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom01"First name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom01" placeholder="First name" value="Mark" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
      div class="fk-valid-feedback"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustomUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="inputGroupPrepend"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustomUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="inputGroupPrepend" required
        div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
          Please choose a username.
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom03" placeholder="City" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid city.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom04" placeholder="State" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid state.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationCustom05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationCustom05" placeholder="Zip" required
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        Please provide a valid zip.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="invalidCheck" required
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="invalidCheck"
        Agree to terms and conditions
      /label
      div class="fk-invalid-feedback"
        You must agree before submitting.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form

script
// Example starter JavaScript for disabling form submissions if there are invalid fields
(function() {
  'use strict';
  window.addEventListener('load', function() {
    // Fetch all the forms we want to apply custom framekit validation styles to
    var forms = document.getElementsByClassName('needs-validation');
    // Loop over them and prevent submission
    var validation = Array.prototype.filter.call(forms, function(form) {
      form.addEventListener('submit', function(event) {
        if (form.checkValidity() === false) {
          event.preventDefault();
          event.stopPropagation();
        }
        form.classList.add('was-validated');
      }, false);
    });
  }, false);
})();
/script
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Browser defaults

Not interested in custom validation feedback messages or writing JavaScript to change form behaviors? All good, you can use the browser defaults. Try submitting the form below. Depending on your browser and OS, you'll see a slightly different style of feedback.

While these feedback styles cannot be styled with CSS, you can still customize the feedback text through JavaScript.

{{capture 'example'}}

  div class="fk-form-row"

    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationDefault02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationDefault02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationDefaultUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="inputGroupPrepend2"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationDefaultUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="inputGroupPrepend2" required
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationDefault03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationDefault03" placeholder="City" required
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationDefault04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationDefault04" placeholder="State" required
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationDefault05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationDefault05" placeholder="Zip" required
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-group"
    div class="fk-form-check"
      input class="fk-form-check-input" type="checkbox" value="" id="invalidCheck2" required
      label class="fk-form-check-label" for="invalidCheck2"
        Agree to terms and conditions
      /label
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Server side

We recommend using client side validation, but in case you require server side, you can indicate invalid and valid form fields with .is-invalid and .is-valid. Note that .invalid-feedback is also supported with these classes.

{{capture 'example'}}
form
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationServer01"First name/label

Supported elements

Our example forms show native textual inputs above, but form validation styles are available for our custom form controls, too.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-was-validated"
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox fk-mb-3"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation1" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation1"Check this custom checkbox/label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"Example invalid feedback text/div
  /div

  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
    input type="radio" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation2" name="radio-stacked" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation2"Toggle this custom radio/label
  /div
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-mb-3"
    input type="radio" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customControlValidation3" name="radio-stacked" required
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customControlValidation3"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"More example invalid feedback text/div
  /div

  div class="fk-form-group"
    select class="fk-custom-select" required
      option value=""Open this select menu/option
      option value="1"One/option

  div class="fk-custom-file"

    label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="validatedCustomFile"Choose file.../label
    div class="fk-invalid-feedback"Example invalid custom file feedback/div
  /div
/form
/div

 Tooltips

If your form layout allows it, you can swap the .{valid|invalid}-feedback classes for .{valid|invalid}-tooltip classes to display validation feedback in a styled tooltip. Be sure to have a parent with position: relative on it for tooltip positioning. In the example below, our column classes have this already, but your project may require an alternative setup.

{{capture 'example'}}
form class="fk-needs-validation" novalidate
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip01"First name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip01" placeholder="First name" value="Mark" required
      div class="fk-valid-tooltip"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip02"Last name/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip02" placeholder="Last name" value="Otto" required
      div class="fk-valid-tooltip"
        Looks good!
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-4 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltipUsername"Username/label
      div class="fk-input-group"
        div class="fk-input-group-prepend"
          span class="fk-input-group-text" id="validationTooltipUsernamePrepend"@/span
        /div
        input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltipUsername" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="validationTooltipUsernamePrepend" required
        div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
          Please choose a unique and valid username.
        /div
      /div
    /div
  /div
  div class="fk-form-row"
    div class="fk-col-md-6 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip03"City/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip03" placeholder="City" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid city.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip04"State/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip04" placeholder="State" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid state.
      /div
    /div
    div class="fk-col-md-3 fk-mb-3"
      label for="validationTooltip05"Zip/label
      input type="text" class="fk-form-control" id="validationTooltip05" placeholder="Zip" required
      div class="fk-invalid-tooltip"
        Please provide a valid zip.
      /div
    /div
  /div
  button class="fk-btn fk-btn-primary" type="submit"Submit form/button
/form
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom forms

For even more customization and cross browser consistency, use our completely custom form elements to replace the browser defaults. They're built on top of semantic and accessible markup, so they're solid replacements for any default form control.

 Checkboxes and radios

Each checkbox and radio is wrapped in a div with a sibling span to create our custom control and a label for the accompanying text. Structurally, this is the same approach as our default .form-check.

We use the sibling selector (~) for all our input states—like :checked—to properly style our custom form indicator. When combined with the .custom-control-label class, we can also style the text for each item based on the input's state.

We hide the default input with opacity and use the .custom-control-label to build a new custom form indicator in its place with ::before and ::after. Unfortunately we can't build a custom one from just the input because CSS's content doesn't work on that element.

In the checked states, we use base64 embedded SVG icons from Open Iconic. This provides us the best control for styling and positioning across browsers and devices.

Checkboxes

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
  input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheck1"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheck1"Check this custom checkbox/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Custom checkboxes can also utilize the :indeterminate pseudo class when manually set via JavaScript (there is no available HTML attribute for specifying it).

div class="bd-example bd-example-indeterminate"
  div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
    input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheck2"
    label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheck2"Check this custom checkbox/label
  /div
/div

If you're using jQuery, something like this should suffice:

{{ highlight html }}
$('.your-checkbox').prop('indeterminate', true)
{{ /highlight }}

 Radios

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="customRadio1" name="customRadio" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadio1"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="customRadio2" name="customRadio" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadio2"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Inline

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-custom-control-inline"
  input type="radio" id="customRadioInline1" name="customRadioInline1" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioInline1"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio fk-custom-control-inline"
  input type="radio" id="customRadioInline2" name="customRadioInline1" class="fk-custom-control-input"
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioInline2"Or toggle this other custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Disabled

Custom checkboxes and radios can also be disabled. Add the disabled boolean attribute to the input and the custom indicator and label description will be automatically styled.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-checkbox"
  input type="checkbox" class="fk-custom-control-input" id="customCheckDisabled" disabled
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customCheckDisabled"Check this custom checkbox/label
/div

div class="fk-custom-control fk-custom-radio"
  input type="radio" id="radio3" name="radioDisabled" id="customRadioDisabled" class="fk-custom-control-input" disabled
  label class="fk-custom-control-label" for="customRadioDisabled"Toggle this custom radio/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Select menu

Custom select menus need only a custom class, .custom-select to trigger the custom styles.

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

You may also choose from small and large custom selects to match our similarly sized text inputs.

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select fk-custom-select-lg fk-mb-3"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select

select class="fk-custom-select fk-custom-select-sm"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

The multiple attribute is also supported:

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select" multiple
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

As is the size attribute:

{{capture 'example'}}
select class="fk-custom-select" size="3"
  option selectedOpen this select menu/option
  option value="1"One/option
  option value="2"Two/option
  option value="3"Three/option
/select
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

 Range

Create custom input type="range" controls with .custom-range. The track (the background) and thumb (the value) are both styled to appear the same across browsers. As only IE and Firefox support "filling" their track from the left or right of the thumb as a means to visually indicate progress, we do not currently support it.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange1"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" id="customRange1"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

Range inputs have implicit values for min and max—0 and 100, respectively. You may specify new values for those using the min and max attributes.

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange2"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" min="0" max="5" id="customRange2"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

By default, range inputs "snap" to integer values. To change this, you can specify a step value. In the example below, we double the number of steps by using step="0.5".

{{capture 'example'}}
label for="customRange3"Example range/label
input type="range" class="fk-custom-range" min="0" max="5" step="0.5" id="customRange3"
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

File browser

The file input is the most gnarly of the bunch and requires additional JavaScript if you'd like to hook them up with functional Choose file... and selected file name text.

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-file"
  input type="file" class="fk-custom-file-input" id="customFile"
  label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="customFile"Choose file/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

We hide the default file input via opacity and instead style the label. The button is generated and positioned with ::after. Lastly, we declare a width and height on the input for proper spacing for surrounding content.

 Translating or customizing the strings

The :lang() pseudo-class is used to allow for translation of the "Browse" text into other languages. Override or add entries to the $custom-file-text Sass variable with the relevant language tag and localized strings. The English strings can be customized the same way. For example, here's how one might add a Spanish translation (Spanish's language code is es):

{{ highlight scss }}

$custom-file-text: (
  en: "Browse",
  es: "Elegir"
);

{{ /highlight }}

Here's lang(es) in action on the custom file input for a Spanish translation:

{{capture 'example'}}
div class="fk-custom-file"
  input type="file" class="fk-custom-file-input" id="customFileLang" lang="es"
  label class="fk-custom-file-label" for="customFileLang"Seleccionar Archivo/label
/div
/div
{{include 'example' content=example}}

You'll need to set the language of your document (or subtree thereof) correctly in order for the correct text to be shown. This can be done using the lang attribute on the html element or the Content-Language HTTP header, among other methods.

Measure

 Measure

Line length, also called "measure", is an important part of readability and its important not to have long lenghts of text for critical read tasks. These are utility classes that ideally should be @included at the sass level but avalable as class names.
